    Tutorial

fit basilica model.

Source: R/basilica.R
fit.Rd

fit the model and infer the underlying signatures and their contributions in the mutational catalogue counts.

Usage

fit(
  x,
  k,
  py = NULL,
  reference_catalogue = COSMIC_filtered,
  input_catalogue = COSMIC_filtered["SBS1", ],
  filtered_cat = FALSE,
  cohort = "MyCohort",
  lr = 0.01,
  steps = 500,
  max_iterations = 20,
  blacklist = NULL,
  phi = 0.05,
  delta = 0.9,
  filt_pi = 0.1,
  groups = NULL,
  lambda_rate = NULL,
  sigma = FALSE,
  CUDA = FALSE,
  compile = FALSE,
  enforce_sparsity = FALSE,
  store_parameters = FALSE,
  regularizer = "cosine",
  reg_weight = 1,
  reg_bic = FALSE,
  cosine_by_subs = FALSE
)

Arguments

x

input mutational counts data (data.frame; rows as samples and columns as 96 mutational categories)

k

vector of possible number of de novo signatures to infer

reference_catalogue

a catalog of reference signatures that basilica will use to compare input and de novo signatures (COSMIC catalogue by default)

input_catalogue

input signature profiles, NULL by default

cohort

add

lr

stochastic variational inference learning rate

steps

number of gradient steps

max_iterations

add

blacklist

add

phi

threshold to discard the signature based on its value in exposure matrix

delta

threshold to consider inferred signature as COSMIC signature

filt_pi

threshold for COSMIC signature weight to be included as basis of the denovo signatures

groups

vector of discrete labels with one entry per sample, it defines the groups that will be considered by basilica

lambda_rate

add

sigma

add

enforce_sparsity

use Laplace prior over exposure weights (bayesian LASSO)

Value

inferred exposure matrix, inferred signatures from reference catalogue and inferred de novo (not from reference catalogue) signatures
